dialogues.JACK:
[1]All in one tape? 
[2]Im not even gonna say it, Kate. Maybe itll be like I never left... 
[3]About the plane? What do you think its gonna crash? Dont say that... 
[4]You mean dont go at all? What about my internship? 
[5]For us, Kate. 
[6]What? 
[7]No, youre right.  What are we doing? 
[8]Okay, I'm going... 
[9]You hear me complaining about that? 
[10]Look, we're at the airport and no one ever thinks clearly at the airport so we should just trust the decision we already made.  You've been accepted to one of the best law schools in the country, I've got this internship at Barclay's Bank. We have a great plan, honey... 
[11]I love you, Kate... 
[12]...and a year in London's not gonna change that.  A hundred years couldn't change that... 
[13]It's not what you think.  I took Mentadent public... 
[14]Of course I did. 
[15]You are an amazing lover.  You should be giving motivational seminars. 
[16]I want to see you again. 
[17]Tonight. 
[18]So we'll get egg nog. 
[19]Jersey?  You know what the traffic's gonna be like? 
[20]I've got plenty of places to go. 
[21]If it's something you feel strongly about. 
[22]Mrs. Peterson. 
[23]Its because Im shy, Betty.  So, when are you going to leave that old corpse Mr. Peterson and run away with me? 
[24]Howd you do this year, Tony? 
[25]Just until the Deutsche Mark turns... 
[26]...if MedTech's shares sink any lower than... ...forty three, we're in trouble with the stock valuation.  So for god's sake watch what you say to your institutional customers... 
[27]...we still have almost a full day of trading before zero hour and I don't want any trouble... ...penny for your thoughts, Alan... 
[28]Is that tonight? 
[29]You think I like being here on Christmas Eve, Alan? 
[30]Okay, maybe I do have a touch of tunnel vision this holiday season.  But in two days we're going to announce one of the largest mergers in U.S. corporate history.  Thirty billion dollars... When this kind of deal turns up you get on and you ride it `till it's over.  You don't ask it for a vacation... 
[31]December 26th.  After that there'll be so much money floating around here it'll be like Christmas every day... December 26th, people.  If you'd like to celebrate that day, you all have my blessing... 
[32]I don't want you to be sorry, Alan, I want you to be excited.  I want my gift to be the first one you open this year.  You know why? 
[33]Because my gift comes with ten zeroes at the end... 
[34]Good man... 
[35]You too?  This holiday's about giving, Adelle.  And I'm giving everything I've got to this deal, so in a way, I'm more Christmassy than anyone... Lifesaver? 
[36]Ooh, my suits are ready... 
[37]Kate Reynolds... 
[38]Her assistant? 
[39]Kate Reynolds was my girlfriend in college.  I almost married her... 
[40]Almost married.  And almost a junior broker at E.F. Hutton... 
[41]She didn't want me to go to London.  We're standing at the airport saying goodbye and she asks me to stay. 
[42]God, no.  I thought about it for practically the entire flight... 
[43]I took the road less traveled, Adelle. 
[44]No... 
[45]She's probably just having a fit of nostalgia.  You know, lonely Christmas Eve, call the one that got away, that kind of thing. 
[46]I'm telling you, it's ancient history... 
[47]Peter.  I don't see you rushing home to trim the tree. 
[48]And God love you for it. 
[49]That'll happen when you're about to spend thirty billion dollars on some aspirin... 
[50]Why are you staring at my breasts, Peter? 
[51]Where is he? 
[52]Call Aunt Irma.  Tell her I won't be able to make it tomorrow... 
[53]Hey Peter, lemme ask you a question.  An old girlfriend calls you out of the blue on Christmas Eve... 
[54]Not by a long shot. 
[55]I'll leave from the office tomorrow afternoon.  Call the group.  Schedule an emergency strategy session for noon. 
[56]I'm thinking I might walk tonight, Frank. 
[57]Thanks.  To you too... 
[58]Egg nog? 
[59]Let me see that ticket. 
[60]Maybe I'll buy it from you. 
[61]Hey, c'mon... 
[62]No. 
[63]Look, I'm talking about a business deal here.  I buy the ticket for two hundred, take it to a store where the guy behind the counter... ...doesn't have a death wish ...I just made myself a quick thirty eight dollars. 
[64]Like I said, it's a business deal... 
[65]How'd you know my name was Jack? 
[66]There's no way I was gonna die in that deli... Let's just say I've been on a lucky streak lately. 
[67]I don't do that.  That's just not for me... 
[68]Hey... 
[69]What do you want to carry that gun around for, anyway? You're just gonna do something you'll regret... 
[70]I'm just saying that you seem like a smart guy.  At a certain point you're gonna do something, and then there's no turning back... 
[71]I mean there must be programs out there, opportunities... 
[72]Everyone needs something. 
[73]Me? 
[74]I've got everything I need. 
[75]Look, I'm not saying you'd be able to do it without some hard work... 
[76]Sure it's about you.  But it's about society, too. 
[77]Ed?  Lorraine? 
[78]Excuse me. 
[79]Wheres my car?!  Wheres my Ferrari!? 
[80]Look, can I just borrow your car?!  I promise itll be returned! 
[81]Tony, thank god... 
[82]What are you talking about?  Its me, Jack Campbell.  Penthouse C. I put you into commercial paper! 
[83]Elizabeth Peterson! 
[84]You know me, Betty.  You do.  Jack Campbell. Were on the co-op board together.  We fought side by side for garbage disposals.  Every morning we exchange quasi-sexual witty banter.  Think... 
[85]Thank you, Betty.  I know if I can just sleep this off, Ill be fine... 
[86]A shelter?!  Im the richest guy in the building...Ive got twice the square footage you have! 
[87]Frank.  Wheres Alan Mintz?  Is he here yet? 
[88]Look, I dont know whats going on here but I am Senior Vice President of this company. 
[89]Maybe youre not hearing me.  I am Jack Campbell... Right here.  Jack Campbell, President... 
[90]Thats my car!  You stole my car! 
[91]What?! 
[92]What the hell is happening to me?! 
[93]Brought what on myself?! I didnt do anything! 
[94]You mean because you thought I was cocky Im now on a permanent acid trip?!! 
[95]Give me my goddamn life back! 
[96]Please.  Just tell me whats happening to me. In plain English.  None of that mumbo jumbo... 
[97]I glimpse?  A glimpse of what!?  What glimpse?! Glimpse! 
[98]I asked you a direct question!  A glimpse of what?! 
[99]How much time?! 
[100]Look, I just want my life back.  Now whats it gonna take?  You wanna talk turkey?  Lets talk turkey!  How much money...? 
[101]Why not? 
[102]Figure it out?  Figure what out?! 
[103]Thats it?  Thats all I get?!  A glare?! 
[104]Look, I dont have time for this right now.  Im in the middle of a deal... 
[105]You know what?  Ive had it with you.  Ive had it with all of this shit... 
[106]Whats this, a signal? Will you come whenever I ring it? 
[107]But what do I do? 
[108]Hey, you did this to me, you cant just leave me like this. 
[109]Thanks, man... 
[110]Excuse me.  Do you know where Merrison Street is? 
[111]Great room... 
[112]Were friends, arent we? 
[113]Im having kind of a bad day. 
[114]Is it...? 
[115]I dont think so. 
[116]Kates my wife... 
[117]Its just two kids, right? 
[118]You cut your hair... 
[119]Yeah...fine. 
[120]I dont know!  Please stop yelling at me! 
[121]I was in the city. 
[122]Because thats where I live. 
[123]Look, you dont understand.  I woke up here...and this is very strange ...this is not my house... 
[124]Im not Dad....  Kate, youre not my wife... 
[125]Im...Im sorry. 
[126]Party?  Oh no, I cant go to a party... 
[127]Trust me on this Kate.  I really dont think going to a party is the right move for me at the present time. 
[128]What are you doing? 
[129]Why not? 
[130]Ill be ready in ten minutes. 
[131]Christ... Where the hell is the bathroom? 
[132]This is just... ...this is sub-par... 
[133]Its lovely... 
[134]The Nets?  Youre kidding, right...? 
[135]Well...theyre certainly due. 
[136]Okay...why? 
[137]Triple bypass? You really think you should be eating all that? 
[138]I dont think so, thank you... 
[139]Theyre great!  Thank you! 
[140]Well do whatever it is you do well, and just...just do it. Excuse me... 
[141]...what do you mean he wont come to the phone?! Do you realize how much money Ive made for that sonuvabitch in the last eight years?! 
[142]Damnit! 
[143]Yes, Im fine.  Its just this god awful football phone!  Who has a phone like this anyway?! 
[144]So youre a lawyer...? 
[145]A non-profit lawyer... 
[146]Pro bono.  You dont get paid at all.  Nobody makes a dime.  Well, bravo... 
[147]Youre kidding me... 
[148]No, shes not. 
[149]But its twenty degrees outside... 
[150]Figure it out...Im s crewed...dont have to be a genius to figure that out... 
[151]Its as good a place as any... 
[152]...but obviously not up to your high standards... Okay...he said youre working on a new deal now...fine, youve done a thousand deals, whats the first thing you do? 
[153]Triage.  Its your signature.  You survey the damage, find out everything you can, you probe, leave nothing to chance.  Im just gonna have to go detective. How did you get Mentadent?  You learned everything there was to know about toothpaste and then you pounced... 
[154]Thats our play here... 
[155]If you could take a dump some time in this century, then we could go home where its warm... 
[156]That is if I can even remember how to get home... You remember, dont you girl? 
[157]Hello? 
[158]Hello! 
[159]
[160]Uh...that babys crying... 
[161]Pull tape... 
[162]Holy mother of god! 
[163]You must be kidding... 
[164]No, Im not. 
[165]I work on Wall Street, you know with the big buildings...? 
[166]I live in an apartment house with a doorman, I can buy just about anything I want... 
[167]This isnt my real life. Its just a glimpse... 
[168]I dont know... 
[169]But dont worry, he loves you and Im sure hell be back very soon... ...very, very soon... 
[170]Who did? 
[171]Uhh...thanks...slightly better looking though, right? 
[172]Youre not going to start crying, are you?  Because Im not really sure I could deal with that right now. 
[173]On a case by case basis... 
[174]I think I could figure it out. 
[175]Sure. 
[176]Check... 
[177]Do I get a receipt or something...? 
[178]Five thirty.  Okay. 
[179]Got it.  Good tip. 
[180]Hey!  Annie! 
[181]Where do I go now? 
[182]Big Eds?  Big Eds Tires? Why...? 
[183]You mean I sell tires... 
[184]Thats what I do.  Im a tire salesman... 
[185]Good Lord... 
[186]Uh...lemme get back to you on that one... Tommy... 
[187]Im gonna have to get back to you on that...Ed. 
[188]Do I have a private office somewhere in the building? 
[189]Thank you. 
[190]Bowlers do it in an alley?...Non profit lawyers do it for free... what is it with these people?  Dont they realize this refers to sex? 
[191]At least you splurged on some decent scotch... 
[192]What are you smiling about...? 
[193]Number one...not bad. 
[194]1988...?  I was in London in 1988... 
[195]You never went to London... ...you never got on that plane... 
[196]...I was the number one junior sales associate at E.F. Hutton in 1988.  Did you know that? 
[197]Thats the kind of thing you can really build on... 
[198]I mean sales has always been a feeder for M and A, always... 
[199]Well, Im just a little confused right now about why I work here... 
[200]Do you know why do I work here...? 
[201]I taught you the business? 
[202]Everything I taught you. I want to hear it all, right now. 
[203]What do you want? 
[204]Here.  These are great. Youll need four. 
[205]Hey, you heard the guy, Im the best damn tire guy in the state of New Jersey. Everything. 
[206]...I have no idea what our inventory level is, thats why Im asking you... 
[207]Look, just send us what you sent us last month, okay...?  And keep doing that until further notice... 
[208]Ive got all the time in the world... 
[209]...and a helluva bridge player.  Eds told me a lot about you... 
[210]I have no idea... 
[211]I mean it.  From what I can tell, were a mom and pop operation, were already over-extended in sales, and any price advantage we could offer would easily be matched by a larger supplier... 
[212]So like I said, I dont have any idea why you should buy your parts from us... 
[213]Except for rule number one... 
[214]The customer is always right.  A cliché?  Sure. The difference is, we mean it.  Were small, we need our customers.  We cant afford to disappoint them, ever. Yeah, you could go to some leviathan supplier, probably save a few pennies on the price of oil filters, but with us you get more than a supplier, you get a bridge partner... 
[215]You want to bid hearts, were right there with you.  You feel the need to redouble, youre not going to get any argument from us... 
[216]The big guys may have the high cards, but you know as well as I do, Sydney, high cards dont always take the trick. 
[217]A Lamaze class...!? 
[218]What?!  Thats my deal? 
[219]Well thats just great...those little monkeys can be a real handful... 
[220]Hey!  I was watching that! 
[221]Im working on a new deal now... 
[222]Wait a second.  You want me, dont you? 
[223]Shouldnt we grab some dinner first?  Maybe a bottle of wine...? 
[224]Whatever you say...honey. 
[225]God...youre beautiful... 
[226]No, Im serious...youre really stunning... 
[227]I mean back in college, you were a very pretty girl, theres no question about that.  But this... ...youve really grown into a beautiful woman... 
[228]Do what? 
[229]Why dont we just go to all the stores?! 
[230]Every single store in this godforsaken shopping mall.  We can go to them all. 
[231]Its an unbelievable thing.  Wearing this suit actually makes me feel like a better person. Im gonna buy it... 
[232]She got those shoes... 
[233]No. 
[234]Do you have any idea what my life is like? 
[235]I wake up in the morning covered in dog saliva...I drop the kids off, spend eight hours selling tires retail...retail, Kate. 
[236]I pick up the kids, walk the dog, which by the way, carries the added bonus of carting away her monstrous crap...I play with the kids, take out the garbage, get six hours of sleep if Im lucky, and then it starts all over again...and why is it that I always have to drive everyone everywhere?  I spend practically my entire day in that slow as hell mini-van listening to Raffi tapes and trying to figure out how the cup holders work...Im sick of it. 
[237]Whats in it for me? Where are my Mary Janes? 
[238]I cant believe its not a disappointment to you! Jesus, Kate, I couldve been a thousand times the man I became.  How could you do this to me?  How could you let me give up on my dreams like this?! 
[239]Look, Im sorry.  Im sorry I was such a saint before and Im such a prick now.  Maybe Im just not the same guy I was when we got married... 
[240]Forget it... Well get a funnel cake. Itll be the highlight of my week... 
[241]Listen, Im sorry about that back in the store. I really dont want to fight with you... 
[242]But you must sometimes wonder how we ended up here.  I mean back in college, did you see us... ...here...? 
[243]It really has, hasnt it?  So if you had to...what would you say was the biggest surprise? 
[244]Surprise.  Were pregnant... Yeah...that mustve been...I mean that was very unexpected.  But what are you gonna do, right? 
[245]Sure.  I really like Annie. 
[246]No, I love Annie.  We had a lot of good times, didnt we? 
[247]Charles Street?  In the Village?  When we were living in Greenwich Village...? Great times.  Whyd we ever leave? 
[248]You had a heart attack? 
[249]Thats why I work for Big Ed? 
[250]I mean, thats why I work for Big Ed... 
[251]So we had a baby, Big Ed had a heart attack, we b ought that house, and Ive been working for him ever since...Sayonara, Wall Street. 
[252]Our life in a nutshell... 
[253]How would you look at it? 
[254]Damn... 
[255]Hey, Im doing the best I can... Id like to see you hit a squash ball after seventeen beers... 
[256]You are Jack Campbell. Youre better than this sport.  You shot the rapids at Kenai.  You ran with the bulls at Pamplona.  You jumped out of a plane over the Mojave Desert, for Christs sake.  You can do this... 
[257]Yeah!! 
[258]Evelyn, right? 
[259]Something like that. 
[260]Youre a nurse? 
[261]Wait a second... 
[262]Are we...? 
[263]Is there something going on between us? 
[264]It would help me if we were. 
[265]Do I have your number? 
[266]I just saw Evelyn Thompson. 
[267]She wants to have an affair with me. 
[268]Pretty much. 
[269]So could you write down her exact address? 
[270]It wouldnt really be cheating... Its complicated. 
[271]Im telling you, those rules dont apply to me, Arn. 
[272]Hey, is that really necessary? 
[273]Long, boring, and generally pretty sad. Arnie seemed to enjoy it... Hey, wheres that chocolate cake...? 
[274]Thats my piece.  I was saving it because I got nauseated from that store bought chicken. 
[275]Gimme that cake. 
[276]Cmon. 
[277]I want that cake! 
[278]I want it... 
[279]Thank you... 
[280]Are the kids asleep?

[282]Yeah, baby, I know what you like to hear... 
[283]Oh yeah, youre a bad girl, baby... You make me so hot...Im gonna take you to that special place... 
[284]Not it...?

[286]Cmon, Lucy, maybe one of us can get a little relief tonight... 
[287]Cmon, girl, lets go home... 
[288]And everyone knows image stabilization is for the weak... 
[289]Its your birthday? Today?  Whats your name?  Where were you born? 
[290]Wait a minute.  Youre my wife? 
[291]I do have one thing I wanna say... 
[292]Oh those fingers in my hair, that sly come hither stare, strips my conscience bare, its witchcraft... 
[293]...and Ive got no defense for it, that heat is too intense for it, what good would common sense for it do... 
[294]...Cause its witchcraft, wicked witchcraft...and although I know its strictly taboo...when you rouse the need in me, my heart says yes indeed in me, proceed with what youre leadin me to... 
[295]Its such an ancient pitch, but one that Id never switch, there aint no nicer witch than you... 
[296]Cause its witchcraft, that koo koo witchcraft...and although I know its strictly taboo... 
[297]...when you rouse the need in me, my heart says yes indeed to me, proceed with what youre leadin me to... 
[298]Its such an ancient pitch, but one that Id never switch... 
[299]Cause theres no nicer witch than you... 
[300]...than you... 
[301]...than you... 
[302]Happy Birthday sweetheart...I love you. 
[303]Maybe I should wait... 
[304]Zeena... 
[305]You really are incredible... 
[306]Youre probably expecting something from me... 
[307]Heres the thing.  I really hadnt planned on giving you your...uh... anniversary gift until tonight. You know, anniversarys good all day... 
[308]I know that, but... 
[309]Ill fix it.  Ill go out right now and get you something.  Ill make it right. 
[310]Please dont cry... 
[311]Cmon...cmon... 
[312]Cmon, goddamnit, how was I supposed to know the date of their anniversary!?  I never married her! 
[313]Like what? 
[314]Dont you think thats a little gimmicky? 
[315]Maybe theres a jewelry store back at the mall. I could get her a pair of earrings or something. 
[316]Right.  Thats a major oversight... So if Im Kate...I cant really afford the finer things, my husbands career is a crushing disappointment to me, Im trapped in suburbia... 
[317]Did he ever take her to the City? 
[318]You look beautiful... 
[319]Thanks, Catherine... 
[320]Fine... 
[321]Whats the difference? Im taking my baby out for our anniversary, damn the costs... 
[322]Arnie... Arnie.  Hell throw you a curve ball once in a while, thats for sure... 
[323]Well have the tureen of quail breast with shiitake mushrooms to start, then the veal medallions in raspberry truffle sauce and the sea scallops with pureed artichoke hearts...sea scallops, North of the Caspian... 
[324]You may... Also, well have a bottle of Lafite, 1982. 
[325]Just a glass of red wine for each of us... 
[326]But Im gettin close, right? 
[327]You want to dance? 
[328]Sure there is... 
[329]I have my moments... 
[330]God I missed that taste... 
[331]Why are you laughing? 
[332]I need to tell you something. 
[333]I think it may help us but theres a slight chance it could make things worse. 
[334]Are you sure? 
[335]I feel like Im living someone elses life... 
[336]I used to be so sure about everything, you know?  I knew exactly who I was and what I wanted. Then one morning I woke up and suddenly it was all different... 
[337]No.  Well, maybe a few things.  But mostly just different... 
[338]I never used to be like this, Kate.  I had it all figured out.  No doubts, no regrets. 
[339]Now...I dont... 
[340]But you always seem so certain. 
[341]Thats a big one for me, too. 
[342]Your pay check is a disgrace to pay checks. 
[343]I guess...some of them are probably faking. 
[344]Its wonderful... 
[345]And...? 
[346]Good things... 
[347]Im sure that right now theres nowhere Id rather be than here with you... 
[348]Ill just full yours up to the top. Happy anniversary, sweetheart. 
[349]Im out of the doghouse? 
[350]Youre so...beautiful... 
[351]My god, all this time...I never stopped loving you... 
[352]I dont think Id fight you on that one... 
[353]For the money, theyre hands down the best radial we carry... 
[354]You wont regret it... Tommy!  Set Mr. Conlin up with four B.F. Goodrich G-Force T/As... ...and give him ten percent off for having the best costume... 
[355]If youre into that kind of conspicuous consumption... 
[356]Sure...be careful, he looks like a tough negotiator... 
[357]Tell Kate Ill call her back... 
[358]Im with a customer. Ill call her back. 
[359]Why dont you let me take this one, Kenny? 
[360]Peter Lassiter... 
[361]Not exactly. Ive seen you on CNBC. You look taller in real life... 
[362]...truth is, Mintz was so busy timing his wifes breathing he didnt see that MedTech needed Global more than the other way around.  Ten days, two weeks tops, they wouldve approached you with an offer, and Id bet anything it wouldve been thirty billion, not twenty nine... Problem was, Peter, you had a pussycat running the show. What you needed was a rottweiler. 
[363]Sure. Were going to have to special order that tire. Itll be ready in about two days. 
[364]Hector...do I usually listen to your personal problems? 
[365]Look, I have some business that I have to take care of in the city so Im leaving early... My advice to you...follow your dreams. 
[366]But youre not interested in boutique dollars... I get it... 
[367]Mr. Mintz. 
[368]I can see that, Alan. 
[369]Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones. 
[370]I was a sales associate, at E.F. Hutton. 
[371]Thats right. And auto supply... 
[372]Uh...we actually get about sixty percent of our business from automotive service. 
[373]We did one point seven million in total revenue... 
[374]Well, Alan, I think were gonna have a banner year. Sales are up almost twenty percent in the first quarter and we just landed a major trucking company account. 
[375]Thats right. And that would make us number one in our market... You mind if I stand? 
[376]Look, I know our paltry little two million in sales is about what you spend on office supplies in a year.  And I know some regional trucking company account is nothing compared to a sixty billion dollar merger... 
[377]Its okay, Alan. I get it. Im in your shoes, Im thinking exactly the same thing...but heres the thing. Business is business.  Wall Street, Main Street, its all just a bunch of people getting up in the morning, trying to figure out how the hell theyre gonna send their kids to college.  Its just people... 
[378]And I know people. 
[379]Take you, for instance... 
[380]You drink about sixteen Diet Cokes a day. Youre an excellent father, but you feel guilty about the time you spend away from home. You drink bourbon, but you offer your clients scotch... 
[381]And your wife decorated this office... 
[382]Youre a little tougher, Peter. 
[383]For one thing, you like expensive things. 
[384]Okay...you smoke Hoyo de Monterreys. Youre a scotch man, single malt, not because its trendy but because youve been doing it for forty years, and you stay with what works. You have two great loves in your life, your horses and this company. You wept openly the day the Dow hit ten thousand... 
[385]And youre a man who prides himself on finding talent in unusual places... 
[386]Because Im here. 
[387]Im prepared to do anything it takes to get this job. Start anywhere you need me to start. Ill park cars if I to... The biggest part of judging character is knowing yourself. And I know this, I can do this job. Give me a chance, Peter, I wont let you down. 
[388]Seven.  Really. 
[389]God, you really are different, arent you... I mean...wow...I am impressed. 
[390]Good for you. Why shouldnt you protect whats yours. 
[391]Oh, Im hearing you, Alan. Thats not the problem. The problem is that what you think is yours, is really mine.  And I dont care how low on the totem pole I start, I will get it back... So do yourself a favor and dont get too attached to that view because sometime soon, maybe very soon, you and your French country antiques, your chintz sofa, and your little play pen are gonna be moving out of that office. 
[392]Oh, and by the way, you try selling tires for a living.  I promise you, youd starve. 
[393]Welcome to Xanadu... 
[394]Pretty incredible, isnt it? 
[395]Think bigger. 
[396]This place is a perk, Kate. 
[397]A company called P.K. Lassiter and Associates Investment House uses it to attract new executives... 
[398]Youre talking to their new Vice President of Mergers and Acquisitions. 
[399]Im going into arbitrage, honey.  Turns out I have a knack for it.  Ill be making two hundred grand a year plus a hefty bonus and thats just to start.  And, we can live in this apartment practically rent free for as long as we want. 
[400]We can finally afford to move back into the city. In style. 
[401]I dont think so. This is going to be a better life for all of us, honey.  Well put Annie and Josh in private schools... 
[402]Im talking about the best schools in the country here, Kate... 
[403]This is New York City, its like the needy people capital of the world.  Those Jersey clients of yours arent a tenth as pathetic as the ones you could get here... 
[404]No, this is the center of the universe.  If I were living in Roman times, I would live in Rome, where else?  Today, America is the Roman Empire and New York is Rome itself. John Lennon. 
[405]Look, Im detecting a kind of funky tension here...We dont have to live in this apartment. I dont need this...Ill commute...Ill drive to work... 
[406]Kate. Youre not understanding me. Im talking about a great life.  A perfect life. Everything we pictured when we were young. The whole package. You said it yourself, life has thrown us surprises, and so we made sacrifices. But now I can finally get us back on track... 
[407]I can do that.  I want to do that.  For all of us. I need to do that as a man... Think about it.  No more lousy restaurants, no more clipping coupons, no more shoveling snow... 
[408]Look, youre making this into something its not. This isnt a referendum on our lives, Kate. Its a step forward... Dont you see?  Im talking about us finally having a life other people envy. 
[409]Very nice. What is it? 
[410]Ah. A classic... 
[411]Please dont stop... 
[412]From London to New York...? I came back... 
[413]What are you doing? 
[414]Four ninety nine?! Its just salt for gods sake... 
[415]You...! 
[416]What are you doing here... 
[417]Youre not sending me back... 
[418]Im not going back... 
[419]Hey! Did you hear me...?! 
[420]Hey, Im talking to you! I am not going back, do you understand...?! 
[421]You cant do this. You cant keep coming in and out of peoples lives, messing things up... 
[422]Ive got kids, Im going home... 
[423]Im staying. 
[424]No, honey. Go back to sleep. 
[425]Take care of yourself, Annie.  Im going back to the mother ship... 
[426]These last weeks, Kate, I know that Ive done some...some unusual things. 
[427]But Ive done some good things too, havent I? 
[428]I need you to remember me, Kate.  How I am right now, right this very moment.  I need you to put that image in your heart and keep it with you, no matter what happens. 
[429]Please, just promise me youll do that. You have to promise, Kate. Because if you dont, then its like it never happened and I dont think I could live with that. 
[430]Promise me again... 
[431]Soon... 
[432]Yeah...okay, send her up... 
[433]Damnit. 
[434]Paula... 
[435]Thats totally see through... 
[436]Christmas?  It cant be Christmas... 
[437]Is Kate here? Does Kate live here?! 
[438]Damn...damn...damn... 
[439]No...Im not... 
[440]Im sorry, no... 
[441]Its me, Jack... 
[442]Tell me you recognize me, Arnie.  Please... 
[443]We bowl together. Were bowlers ...we won a championship...were winners. 
[444]Yes...Jack Campbell... 
[445]Yes, thats it...yes, we went to high school together. 
[446]Yeah...I guess I just wanted you to know, we couldve been really good friends... 
[447]Hello? 
[448]Adelle? 
[449]Ill be there in twenty minutes... 
[450]Whats going on here? 
[451]You know something, Alan. Theres a much more assertive person somewhere inside of you... 
[452]But I think I like you better this way... 
[453]No. 
[454]Ill tell you exactly what were going to do.  Youre going to do whatever you have to do to find out which European company hes been talking to.  Then Im going to clean myself up, fly to Aspen, and drink egg nog with Bob Thomas.  His wife and kids will be playing in the background while I spend Christmas day convincing him that the European company is the devil and Global is the answer to his prayers, after all... Then Im going to spend four hours skiing. Alone. On Christmas day. Completely and utterly alone. Im going to do that because that is my life, that is whats real, and there is nothing I can do to change that... 
[455]For Manhattan...Kate Reynolds...I need an address too... 
[456]Make a right here... 
[457]Were not going to the airport... 
[458]Im Jack Campbell...Im an old... friend of Kates. I just called. 
[459]Kate... 
[460]You look great. 
[461]I'm sorry... 
[462]Whats going on? 
[463]Paris? 
[464]Youre moving... 
[465]To Paris. Paris, France. 
[466]So youre not at a non- profit firm? 
[467]Youre not married, are you? 
[468]Not exactly... Can we just take a minute here?  Maybe get a cup of coffee or something...? 
[469]Do you ever think about us, Kate?  About what might have happened...? 
[470]Sure. Goodbye, Kate. 
[471]Kate! 
[472]You cant go! 
[473]Dont get on that plane! 
[474]Please. Lets just go have a cup of coffee. Thats all Im asking for. Im sure theres another flight to Paris tonight. 
[475]We have a house in Jersey! 
[476]We have two kids, Annie and Josh... 
[477]...Annies not much of a violin player but she tries really hard. Shes a little precocious but thats only because she says whats on her mind. And when she smiles... 
[478]And Josh...he has your eyes. He doesnt say much but we know hes smart... ...hes always got his eyes open, always watching us... sometimes you can look at him and just know that hes learning something new... its like witnessing a miracle... 
[479]...the house is a mess, but its ours... ...well, after a hundred twenty two more payments it will be... 
[480]And you...youre a non- profit lawyer. Thats right, completely non-profit. But that doesnt seem to bother you... 
[481]And were in love. After thirteen years of marriage were still unbelievably in love... You wont even let me touch you until Ive said it... 
[482]...I sing to you...not all the time but definitely on special occasions... 
[483]Excuse me... We made a lot of sacrifices, dealt with our share of surprises, but we stayed together... 
[484]You see, youre a better person than I am... 
[485]...and it made me a better person to be around you... 
[486]Maybe it was all a dream. Maybe I went to bed one lonely night in December and imagined it all. But I swear, nothings ever felt more real to me... 
[487]And if you get on that plane right now, itll disappear forever. 
[488]I know we can both go on with our lives. And wed both be fine. But Ive seen what we can be like together...And I choose us... 
[489]Please, Kate, one cup of coffee. You can always go to Paris. Just please, not tonight...
dialogues.KATE:
[1]I got you a few necessities... 
[2]Your copy was a mess... 
[3]Every one of these songs will remind you of me in a slightly different way... 
[4]I also put side two of London Calling on there... 
[5]That was not officially the goodbye kiss. It was just an interim kiss... 
[6]You have your ticket? 
[7]Wait. 
[8]I have a bad feeling about this. 
[9]I know weve talked about this a thousand times and we both agree that going to London is the right thing to do. But in my heart... this feels wrong. 
[10]Dont  go, Jack... 
[11]Believe me I know what an incredible opportunity this is for you... 
[12]Right, for us. But...Im afraid that if you get on that plane... 
[13]Go. Im sorry, you should just go... 
[14]We're being responsible.  Go. Get on the plane. 
[15]Get the hell outta my sight. You bother me. 
[16]I can't seem to let go of you... 
[17]You want to do something great, Jack?  Let's flush the plan...start our lives right now, today...I don't know what that life's gonna look like but I do know it has both of us in it.  And I choose us... 
[18]The plan doesn't make us great, Jack.  What we have together, that's what makes us great. 
[19]Mmmm...ten more minutes, Jack... its Christmas... 
[20]Youre jumping, sweetheart... 
[21]Mommy needs five more minutes in la la land. That could be her present... 
[22]Jack...? 
[23]Strong coffee, okay? 
[24]Use an entire can if you have to! 
[25]Hold on a second... 
[26]Ten years ago... 
[27]Are you okay? 
[28]Never mind, he just walked in... 
[29]Do you have any idea what you put us through today?!  You walk out of here at 7:30 in the morning, dont tell me where youre going, or even that youre going, and I dont see you til hours later.  I had state troopers looking for you!  I called hospitals... ...I was just on the phone with the morgue for gods sake! 
[30]What kind of man leaves his family on Christmas morning without a word about where hes going? Jacks almost to a breaking poINT. 
[31]What kind of man does that!? 
[32]Where were you? 
[33]The city?  New York City?  Why? 
[34]Jack...dont even start... 
[35]You know what, Jack? Its not funny this time.  Im really angry. 
[36]Jack! 
[37]You missed the whole thing, Jack.  The pancakes, the presents...you spent six hours putting that bike together and you didnt even get to see the look on Annies face when she opened it... 
[38]You missed Christmas, Jack. 
[39]Look, we dont have time for this right now, well talk about it later.  Now get dressed... Youre not wearing that to the Thompsons party. I dont care how hilarious you think it is... 
[40]You look forward to this party all year.  Whats with you today? 
[41]Fine.  Do whatever you want. 
[42]Telling my mother she doesnt have to stay with the kids. 
[43]Because youll be here. 
[44]Funny, Jack.  Im laughing on the inside. 
[45]Jack...? 
[46]Are you sure youre okay...? 
[47]Uh huh... 
[48]You must really love Evelyns mushroom puffs, huh? You know theyre not real... 
[49]...then she asks me to put this sweater on. What choice do I have, right? 
[50]But as Im slipping it on I notice shes misspelled the word lawyers. I had to go through the entire day wearing a hand embroidered sweater that said, Non-Profit Layers Do It For Free. 
[51]Jack... 
[52]I better go wake my mother... 
[53]Here you go... 
[54]Shes your dog, Jack. 
[55]Fine, shes the kids dog.  Lets go wake Josh, see if he wants to walk her. 
[56]Youre having a bad day, Ill go with you...actually, theres no way in hell youre gettin me back out there... 
[57]Make sure you reward her verbally when she does a number two... 
[58]...my feet are hurtin... 
[59]And...? 
[60]Dont give me that look, Jack, Tuesdays your day and you know it.  And try to get Josh to day care on time, okay?  He missed the macaroni painting last week... 
[61]The kids are asleep... 
[62]Jack.  I said the kids are asleep... 
[63]I thought we had a deal about you watching CNBC in bed. 
[64]Fine, but not tonight... 
[65]That is the general idea, yes... 
[66]Its ten thirty, Jack. By eleven youre gonna be sprawled out on the bed snoring your head off. We dont have time for wining and dining. 
[67]Thanks, Jack... 
[68]This is good stuff, Jack, keep it coming... 
[69]How can you do that? 
[70]Look at me like you havent seen me every day for the last twelve years... 
[71]Dont move. 
[72]night, honey... 
[73]Were almost done here... 
[74]Thats right.  Okay, lets make a quick stop at the kids shoe department, pick up my watch from the battery place, then Ill run into the linen store... 
[75]You know what, Jack?! Ill go with the kids. Why dont you just hang out here in the mens department... okay? 
[76]You look amazing in that suit... 
[77]I mean...wow...off the charts great. 
[78]$2,400?!  Are you out of your mind? 
[79]Those shoes were twenty five dollars.  Cmon, take it off.  Well go to the food court and get one of those funnel cakes you like. 
[80]No? 
[81]Excuse me? 
[82]Really. 
[83]Its sad to hear your life is such a disappointment to you, Jack. 
[84]Who are you? 
[85]Maybe youre not.  The Jack Campbell I married wouldnt need a $2400 suit to make himself feel better about his life, but if thats what its gonna take, then buy it. Just buy the goddamn suit ...we can take the money out of the kids college fund. 
[86]Ill give you this, life has thrown us a few surprises... 
[87]Well...Annie for one. 
[88]I think it worked out okay, dont you? 
[89]Good, Jack.  Maybe well keep her. 
[90]We were young... Remember that little place on Charles Street we used to go to? 
[91]You cant really raise a kid in an apartment in the Village... 
[92]The trek out to the hospital every day didnt help either... You were great. Surviving the heart attack was one thing... 
[93]Jack, stop that. I'm still mad at you... ...who knows what wouldve happened if you hadnt stepped in at the store. 
[94]If you want to look at it that way... 
[95]A great success story... 
[96]How was the game, honey? 
[97]You mean this chocolate cake? 
[98]Its good... 
[99]No way. 
[100]Sorry, Jack.  Its too important to me. 
[101]You want the cake!? 
[102]Its good, right? 
[103]Say it, Jack... 
[104]Cmon, you know what I like to hear... 
[105]Then say it...just say it to me...! 
[106]What...? 
[107]Nice, Jack.  Youre sweeping me off my feet. 
[108]Jack. 
[109]Time to get up, honey... 
[110]Happy Anniversary, honey... 
[111]Before you do whatever crazy stunt youve got planned I want you to open mine... 
[112]No, open it... 
[113]I found it at an outlet store.  I know its a knock-off, but I think itll look great on you... 
[114]Enjoy it, sweetheart... 
[115]What are you talking about?  You never wait all day.  You can barely wait until its light out. 
[116]You forgot. 
[117]You actually forgot our anniversary. 
[118]Jesus, Jack...Is this where we are now?  Is this our marriage? Suddenly Im the wife who has to drop hints two weeks before her anniversary so her husband doesnt fuck it up? 
[119]I dont want to be that, Jack... 
[120]Which do you think? 
[121]Fightings a part of it, Annie.  You know that, right? 
[122]Cmere. 
[123]Now go like this... 
[124]Youre gonna break a lot of hearts, you know. 
[125]You okay? 
[126]Jack...can we afford all this? 
[127]How do you even know about this place? 
[128]Its five hundred and fifty dollars, Jack! 
[129]You are so not off the hook yet, slick. 
[130]I dont think theres dancing here, Jack. 
[131]Pretty good for a tire salesman from Jersey... 
[132]Mmmm... ...here, try one of these... 
[133]Okay... 
[134]Now Im worried...just say it.  Whatever it is well deal with it. 
[135]Worse, you mean... 
[136]And now...? 
[137]Me neither. 
[138]I think its good to be a little unsure about who you are.  Its very human. 
[139]Cmon, Jack, you think there arent mornings when I wake up and wonder what the hell Im doing in New Jersey... 
[140]My office is a dump, I answer my own phone...and youve seen my pay check. 
[141]I mean yes, I help people that need it... 
[142]God, sometimes I think it would be so nice not to have to stretch ground beef or maybe drive a car with a CD player... 
[143]Imagine having a life where everything was easy...where you asked for things and people just brought them to you... 
[144]I think about it, too, Jack.  I do.  I think about the kind of person Id be if I hadnt married you... 
[145]And I realize Ive just erased the things in my life Im most sure about.  You, the kids... 
[146]What are you sure about? 
[147]This is so beautiful... 
[148]You know champagne makes me do crazy things. 
[149]I dont know how you did it, hoss, but you pulled it off. 
[150]Way out... 
[151]You may even get lucky tonight... 
[152]I already told you you were gonna get lucky, Jack... 
[153]Thats all I wanted to hear... 
[154]Mmmm...Jack... 
[155]I feel like I should give you money... 
[156]I mean, my god, Jack you were always good but this...this was... like a porno movie. 
[157]I could stay here forever... 
[158]Have a good day... 
[159]Its like a museum. 
[160]So whats the big surprise? You didnt rent this place for the weekend, did you? 
[161]For the week? 
[162]A perk for what? 
[163]What are you talking about, Jack? 
[164]Are you out of your mind? 
[165]Annie goes to a great school. 
[166]Jack, what could you possibly be thinking? What about my job? 
[167]I cant believe you want to move back into the city.  I thought the reason we left was because we didnt want to raise the kids here? 
[168]Jack. 
[169]In traffic?  Its over an hour each way?  Thats almost three hours a day.  When are you going to see the kids? 
[170]Then get a goddamn snow blower! 
[171]Dont get a new career without even telling me. Dont take Annie out of a school she loves.  Dont move us out of a house weve become a family in... 
[172]Dont do that... 
[173]They already do envy us, Jack... 
[174]Our finest moment, right... 
[175]When you got on that plane I was sure it was over.  I left the airport afraid Id never see you again.  And then you showed up the very next day... That was a good surprise... 
[176]I think about you on that plane, about what must have been going through your mind...you sitting there imagining our life together, our life apart...I think about the decision you made... 
[177]Maybe I was being naive but I believed wed grow old together in this house.  That wed spend holidays here, have g randchildren visit us here.  I had this image of us all grey and wrinkly, me working in the garden, you repainting the deck... 
[178]Things change, right? People change... If you need this, Jack, I mean really need this, I will take these children from a life they love, and take myself from the only home weve ever shared, and move wherever you need to go.  Ill do that because I love you... 
[179]I love you, Jack. And thats more important to me than our address... 
[180]I choose us. 
[181]Hey... 
[182]Its been interesting, thats for sure. 
[183]Youve been Jack Campbell.  And thats always a good thing... 
[184]Are you okay, Jack? 
[185]I promise, Jack... 
[186]I promise. Come to bed, honey. 
[187]Did you call the airline like I asked?! 
[188]Jack...God, its been so long...You look... 
[189]Its good to see you... 
[190]Lori! Wheres that box?! 
[191]Dont worry about it, Jack... 
[192]Im moving to Paris...it was right here... Its a box marked Jack.  I put it in the stack for the Salvation Army... 
[193]Hey, kind of under a little pressure here. 
[194]You didnt seem to mind offering to help me on Christmas day when you were unwrapping that Prada bag I gave you. 
[195]Uh huh. To Paris. My firm has an office there and Im going to be heading it up. 
[196]Thats the one... 
[197]Not with what they pay me... 
[198]No, Jack, I never got married. You? 
[199]Yes! 
[200]I found it! 
[201]Here you go.  Its just some old things of yours... 
[202]Youre serious... 
[203]Ill tell you what, Jack, if youre ever in Paris, look me up. Maybe well go for that cup of coffee. 
[204]Jesus, Jack... 
[205]Jack. 
[206]What do you want from me? You want me to tell you everything that happened was okay? 
[207]Well it is. Yes, I was heartbroken ...But I got over it. I moved on. People change, Jack. I changed. I dont know why you suddenly feel the need to revisit that time in our lives but I assure you, its over... 
[208]Dont do this, Jack... But he continues... 
[209]Okay, Jack...
dialogues.CASH:
[1]Oh yeah...yeah, yee-ah!  She's a certified winner...paper- thin but good as gold... 
[2]Y'all do the lotto here...? `Cause I got me a winner...I know, I know, Lotto keeps the black man down... but not me... 
[3]...06...14...18...48...right there.  Four numbers...that's two hundred and thirty eight dollar... Merry Christmas and shit... 
[4]What're you talkin' about? 
[5]What!?  Look at the ticket...! 
[6]You're lookin' at me, you're not even lookin' at the ticket! 
[7]You first generation, xenophobic, money-theistic, hot pastrami sandwich making... 
[8]
[9]Was I talkin' to you?! 
[10]Guy in $2,000 suit gets ass kicked tryin' to be a hero. Film at eleven... What?!  Oh no, not another lookie-loo.  You know how big a job this is? 
[11]You're double bookin' me! You're gonna get double billed!  Shit! 
[12]Do you want to die? 
[13]
[14]Yes you do... 
[15]Damn, you are the real thing... 
[16]C'mon, Jack, let's get outta here... You were lookin' at me, papa, you shoulda been lookin' at the ticket.  That ticket was legit, B.  You're fake... 
[17]I call all you white guys "Jack." 
[18]You know you seem pretty relaxed for a guy who just had a gun pulled on him. 
[19]A lucky streak, huh? 
[20]Sound pretty sure of yourself, don't you? 
[21]So you're telling me, you've got a gun to your head and you don't think for one second, what if this, what if that, maybe I shouldn't do this, I shoulda done that. 
[22]Okay, Jack.  Nice doing business with you... Cash is about to take off... 
[23]You want to talk about regrets, you're talking to the wrong person. 
[24]Yeah, in most cases that'd be true. 
[25]Wait a minute, wait a minute... you're tryin' to save me? 
[26]Oh man, you're serious... This man thinks I need to be saved! 
[27]Yeah?  What do you need? 
[28]You just said everyone needs something. 
[29]Wow.  It must be great being you.  You got it all. 
[30]You still think this is about me, don't you? 
[31]Oh man, I'm gonna enjoy this one... Just remember, Jack, you did this.  You brought this on yourself... 
[32]Miss me, Jack? 
[33]Its a callable asset seized in accordance with the acquisition by-laws of your alt-fate contract... 
[34]Basically, its my car now.  Get in. 
[35]Look, I dont make the rules, Jack.  This is how it works.  Get in. 
[36]Might wanna fasten your seat belt, Jack... 
[37]This kinda thing makes a lotta guys throw up. Seen it happen.  So if you get the urge, do it out the window. I dont want you marring this exquisite leather interior... 
[38]Look, I dont know what youre getting so worked up about, you did this...you brought this on yourself. 
[39]No?  Cmon, Jack...Ive got everything I need, I dont have regrets, thats just not for me... sound familiar? 
[40]Everyone else in that store is a statue, they see their lives passing in front of their eyes, but not you.  Youre making a business deal... 
[41]You?  What about me?  Im working hard for you here, Jack.  On Christmas too!  Now you did a good thing last night, intervening that way.  I was moved... 
[42]Its a glimpse, Jacko. 
[43]Look, eventually, everybody gets one...some of em take a couple seconds... ...some of em take a lot longer... 
[44]Figure it out.  You got plenty of time. 
[45]As long as it takes to figure it out.  Which, in your case, could be considerable. 
[46]Do I look like I need your money.  It doesnt work like that and I cant tell you why. 
[47]Because you got to figure it out for yourself. Are you listening to me? 
[48]Look Jack, in my experience the best way people deal with this is to just relax and breathe through it...let it come to you. 
[49]Oh youre working on a new deal now...did I mention that? 
[50]Here... 
[51]Do I look like I live in a bottle? 
[52]Look Jack Im late.  Id love to help you out some more but I gotta go handle my business... Happy trails. 
[53]Fine.  You want to know everything, Ill tell you everything.  But not here.  Lets get some air... 
[54]Thatll be sixty five cents, little angel... 
[55]Jack, its good to see you... 
[56]Thank you darlin... 
[57]seeing the rock salt 
[58]Everything okay...? 
[59]That was a character issue... ...and for nine dollars? Thats just sad... 
[60]Cmon, Jack... 
[61]You know what the word glimpse means, J? Its by nature an impermanent thing.
dialogues.ARNIE:
[1]Jeannie!  I found Jack! 
[2]You look terrible... 
[3]Truth is I expected you. Kate called before and asked if I knew where you were. 
[4]I know, I moved the Barca-lounger into the corner.  Its throwin everybody off.  What do you think? 
[5]You and me, buddy.  We know how to live... 
[6]So Jack, you okay? 
[7]I mean you leave the house on Christmas morning, you dont tell anyone where youre going... 
[8]Maybe I dont say it enough but you moving in next door to me... 
[9]Talk to me... 
[10]I read somewhere that the suicide rate doubles during the holidays... 
[11]What am I saying?  You dont need to hear that... All I meant was a lot of people have a hard time dealing with all the forced reverie, thats all.  Is that you? 
[12]Trouble at work? 
[13]Its not Kate, is it? 
[14]You see, its like were in each others heads... 
[15]Just keep saying it, Jack, like a mantra. 
[16]Cmon, I better walk ya home.  Shes mad enough as it is, right...? 
[17]Look, you fit the profile exactly.  Thirties, house, kids, financial responsibilities.  You start thinking...this isnt the life I dreamt about.  Wheres the romance, wheres the joie de vivre?  Suddenly, every lingerie ad in the Newark Star Ledger represents a life you cant have... 
[18]You made a choice, Jack, a promise to your wife. Maybe sometimes it seems like you gave up the world, but look what you got... 
[19]Four bedrooms, two and a half baths, and a partially finished basement... 
[20]Kids... 
[21]Okay look, you probably dont want to hear this right now but remember what you told me last summer when I almost had that thing with Arnie Jr.s speech therapist. 
[22]Dont screw up the best thing in your life just because youre a little unsure about who you are.  Okay? 
[23]God, it feels so good to finally give something back to you... 
[24]Im gonna hug you now... 
[25]Good thinking, Bill. Have another drink. Hell be lucky if he lives through the night... 
[26]Jesus, Jack, this is a league match, for gods sake! 
[27]Wheres your follow through?  Wheres your stance? 
[28]Youre right.  Why am I so competitive!? Compensation, I guess. Look, just focus, Jack. You can still pick up the spare... 
[29]Okay, Pete, youre up. 
[30]Hey Jack, youre all flush.  I guess that seventy-one took a lot outta you. 
[31]She is relentless. 
[32]She said that? 
[33]Oh yeah... What is it about you? 
[34]Whoa...whoa...wait a second, Jack.  Youre not actually gonna cheat on Kate? 
[35]Look, maybe Im not as good a consigliere as you are but you have to trust me on this one.  A little flirtations harmless but youre playing with fire here.  The Fidelity Bank and Trust is a tough creditor.  You make a deposit somewhere else, they close your account forever. 
[36]Screw the rules.  Im talking about the choice. 
[37]Cmon, Evelyn Thompsons got no class.  She doesnt marry Dr. Steve, the womans living in a trailer. 
[38]All Im saying it there isnt a guy in Union County who wouldnt give his left nut to be married to Kate... 
[39]Ill see ya later, Jack... 
[40]Jesus, Bill, this thing is an antique.  Dont you even have image stabilization? 
[41]So Jack, its your wifes birthday, got anything to say to her? 
[42]Hey, you cant park that thing here. 
[43]I dont care if youre Tim Allen with your fancy car and all your tools, you still cant park here. 
[44]Howd you know my name? 
[45]I never won anything in bowling. 
[46]Wait a second... Jack...Jack... 
[47]Of course. Jack Campbell. I went to high school with you...you played baseball, right? Youre doing well... 
[48]You never really talked to me.  I wanted to talk to you, man...
dialogues.ANNIE:
[1]Jingle bells, Santa s mells, Rudolph laid an egg...la la la, la-la la la, la la la la la... 
[2]You too, Luce... 
[3]Rise...and...shine...! 
[4]Mom, dont you think we need to open the presents? 
[5]Cmon, Dad.  Get up! 
[6]Whats that? 
[7]I like this... ...thanks, Dad! 
[8]Youre not really our dad, are you? 
[9]Wheres my real dad? 
[10]They did a pretty good job. 
[11]The aliens...In the mother ship.  You look just like him. 
[12]Do you like kids? 
[13]You know how to make chocolate milk? 
[14]You promise not to kidnap me and my brother and implant stuff in our brains? 
[15]Welcome to earth. 
[16]Stop here... 
[17]This is day care.  Its where babies go when their parents are at work. 
[18]I have winter camp until four, then ballet until five thirty. 
[19]Try not to be late because kids dont like to be the last one picked up. 
[20]Bye... 
[21]Big Eds. 
[22]Thats where you work. 
[23]Mary Janes, Mom.  You promised. 
[24]Put the bicycle back on the ground... 
[25]Not bad...I shoulda warned you.  Dad always does something really special for their anniversary. 
[26]One year he had a solar system named after her... 
[27]Mom liked it. 
[28]Thats good but...you did forget the anniversary. 
[29]Youre really gettin the hang of this. 
[30]The black one... 
[31]Im not worried, Mom. Hes still learning our ways... 
[32]Really? 
[33]Mary Had A Little Lamb. 
[34]I knew youd come back... 
[35]Ringing my bell... 
[36]Is it morning yet?
dialogues.ALAN:
[1]Sorry, Jack.  I told Dee and the kids I'd be home by dinner.  You know, it being Christmas Eve and all. 
[2]I don't know.  Maybe... 
[3]You're right, Jack.  Sorry... Jack approaches Alan. 
[4]Why Jack? 
[5]Jack, of course. 
[6]Please, call me Alan. We try to cultivate a casual atmosphere around here... 
[7]You have kids, Jack? 
[8]Thats great... Why dont you have a seat? 
[9]So, Peter mentioned that you were an avid CNBC watcher but didnt say whether you had any actual Wall Street experience? 
[10]A broker? Really. And now youre in the tire business? 
[11]Uh huh. The retail end, I understand. 
[12]Mind if I ask what kind of sales you did last year? Ballpark... 
[13]Uh huh...one point seven. And what do you project for this year? 
[14]Any thoughts at all on that? 
[15]Jack? 
[16]Really. So youre projecting what, a tad over two million? 
[17]Im not trying to knock the tire business, Jack. 
[18]Im sure you do... 
[19]What about me? 
[20]Id love to. 
[21]...thats our war room. We did seven major deals last year, three of them hostile. 
[22]Lets cut the shit, huh Campbell? What, did you go through his wallet or something? 
[23]No matter. That circus act back there may have dazzled Lassiter momentarily but it doesnt do shit forme. Even if you get this job, which I highly doubt, let me warn you, Lassiter loses interest in his pet projects very quickly. Im in the big office because Ive proved myself to him year after year and nobody is going to come in here and start turning the old mans head. Especially not some tire salesman from New Jersey. So you watch yourself and stay away from Lassiter, and maybe, just maybe, Ill keep you on after he gets tired of you. Do we understand each other? 
[24]Do we?! 
[25]I dont think youre hearing me. 
[26]Thank god, Jacks here. Ill call you right back... 
[27]Jack, are you okay? 
[28]Its not good.  Bob Thomas has secretly been talking to a European drug company. Were not sure which one, Julias on it right now. Word is theyre willing to let him buy a minority stake and keep running the entire company.  The Global people are up in arms.  They say we shouldve been prepared for this.  Were in trouble here, Jack... 
[29]Excuse me? 
[30]Is this another one of those Sun Tzu Art of War tricks? 
[31]So what are we gonna do, Jack? 
[32]Jack...?
dialogues.LASSITER:
[1]Eight forty-five on Christmas Eve and Jack Campbell is still at his desk.  There's a Hallmark moment for you... 
[2]That's because I'm a heartless bastard who only cares about money. 
[3]I just got a call from Terry Haight.  Bob Thomas is nervous... 
[4]Someone's gonna have to nurse him through this. 
[5]I need you, tiger.. 
[6]Aspen. 
[7]You're a credit to capitalism, Jack. 
[8]You suddenly having trouble getting dates? 
[9]Then leave it in the past. Old flames are like old tax returns.  You keep `em in the file cabinet for three years and then you cut `em loose. 
[10]I seem to have had some kind of blow out... 
[11]Do I know you? 
[12]Well, Im impressed. 
[13]I really am... 
[14]So, about my car... 
[15]This has my office address on it... Why dont you drop it off yourself? 
[16]...were really more of a boutique operation, as you can see... 
[17]Alan, this is Jack Campbell...the one I was telling you about... 
[18]Lets let the man have his say... 
[19]He certainly has your number, Alan. 
[20]Thats easy. Youve seen my car. 
[21]Oh? And how would you 
[22]Alan, why dont you show Jack around a bit...
dialogues.EVELYN:
[1]Kate!  Jack! Everybody, Jack and Kate are here! 
[2]Like the dress...? 
[3]I thought I saw you notice it at the kids recital. 
[4]Finger food...? 
[5]Cmon, as soon as I put them down, youre gonna grab a couple...you always do... 
[6]Let me.  Theyll melt in your mouth... 
[7]Good? 
[8]Mushroom puffs arent the only thing I do well... 
[9]Hi Jack... 
[10]Very funny.  I saw you out there on lane five. What do you have the flu or something? 
[11]Need a nurse? 
[12]If thats what you want... 
[13]Are we what, Jack? 
[14]Are we finally being honest? 
[15]Okay, youre right, weve been dancing around this for years... 
[16]God, my heart is racing. Here goes... When I get dressed for a party and I know youre going to be there... well, lets just say I dont go strapless because my husband likes it... 
[17]Ive got six sets of snow tires piled up in my garage and I wont even drive in the snow...And our kids just happen to be in the same ballet class every year? 
[18]So, if youre asking me whether Id like it to be more, the answer is yes... 
[19]...and Kate would never have to know. 
[20]Steves out of town with the kids this week.  Why dont you just stop by...
dialogues.PAULA:
[1]I hope you don't mind.  There were like ten new ones in the cabinet. 
[2]Did you really mean what you said about Tuscany? 
[3]Last night was great... 
[4]Thanks.  You're not bad yourself... 
[5]I'd like that, too. 
[6]It's Christmas Eve, Jack. 
[7]I have to go to my parents' house out in Jersey.  Would you like to come? 
[8]I'm taking the train... 
[9]Don't you have anywhere to go? 
[10]Maybe I can try and sneak away some time tomorrow morning... Okay? 
[11]It was nice meeting you, Jack... 
[12]Waiting for me by the door, huh? 
[13]Merry Christmas... 
[14]Its whatever you want it to be, Jack... 
[15]Jack?...Jack!
dialogues.ADELLE:
[1]Only eight thirty?  What's the matter, had some last minute shopping to do? 
[2]You're a ray of sunshine, Jack. 
[3]Oh, and Oxxford called... 
[4]Her assistant said you could call her at home after eight. 
[5]Yeah Jack, her assistant... 
[6]You?  Married? 
[7]Excuse me? 
[8]So you left her?  Just like that? 
[9]Stop Jack, I'm getting all weepy. 
[10]And look where it's led you... I'm gonna get her on the phone... 
[11]No?!  You almost married this woman.  Aren't you even curious what she wants? 
[12]That'll be a nice little holiday treat. 
[13]Hey Santa, where are you? Everybodys here. 
[14]You were supposed to be here half an hour ago...the emergency strategy session? Your trip to Aspen? Theyre all panicked here... 
[15]Jack...? Are you going through the tunnel?
dialogues.BIG ED:
[1]Jack you ol bird dog. Merry Christmas to ya... 
[2]I heard that.  This is who I am, woman! Tell her, Jack!  Youre the only one who gets me, for gods sake! 
[3]Course you do.  Hell, its almost 8 a.m. Where are my two lil pardners?  Annie!  Josh! Giddy up, Bid Eds here! 
[4]Damned if I know... 
[5]What the hell are you talking about? Whats he talking about? 
[6]The Caddy?  Why dont you take your own damn car! 
[7]Hes got a perfectly good mini-van sitting out there in the driveway! 
[8]Jack my boy!  You are looking mighty worse for the wear...Hey, guess who I played bridge with two nights ago...? 
[9]Hell, youll never guess.  One Sydney Potter.  Thats Sydney Potter, Chief Executive Officer of BuyRite Transport.  Only the third largest trucking company in the state.  I even let the sonuvabitch win, which wasnt easy because the guys been bashed in the head by Teamsters so many times his brains like porridge.  Anyhoo, hes looking for a new parts supplier... we can handle that kind of volume, right? 
[10]Got a minute, Jack? 
[11]Jack, meet Sydney Potter, BuyRite Transport, one of Jerseys top businessmen... 
[12]My daughters no slouch either... 
[13]Cmon Jack... 
[14]Thats my boy... Cmon, lemme show you the rest of the ranch... 
[15]Nice shootin, Jack...
dialogues.KENNY:
[1]Uh...sure Jack... Right back there... 
[2]No, I didnt...thats great. 
[3]Uh huh... 
[4]Here we are, mag wheels... Hey Jack, are you sure youre okay? 
[5]Uh...I just started here last Tuesday. 
[6]Kates on two, Jack. Nice ride... 
[7]You want me to handle him?  I think Im ready... 
[8]Okay, chief.
dialogues.LORI:
[1]Are you from the shipping company? 
[2]Kate! Some guys here! 
[3]Do you want me to look for the box or call the airline? 
[4]Hey, kind of giving up Christmas day for my ex-boss here. 
[5]Maybe its by the wardrobe boxes... 
[6]Ill go for a cup of coffee! 
[7]Congratulations. The La Guardia flights canceled but I got you out of Kennedy on United at nine. Am I good or what?
dialogues.FRANK:
[1]Mr. Campbell.  Why didn't you call down, I would've had Joe get your ride. 
[2]Nice night for it.  I'll have Louis send your car home. 
[3]Merry Christmas to you, sir... 
[4]Whoa, whoa, whoa...hold it right there... 
[5]Mr. Mintz? I dont think so...buildings closed pal.  Youll have to come back tomorrow. 
[6]I dont care who you are.  Its Christmas and like I told you the building is closed.
dialogues.SAM WONG:
[1]Dairy case.  Five dollar. 
[2]Ticket bad.  You draw in lines with pencil. 
[3]You draw lines with pencil!  I know about this! 
[4]Get out, I call 911. 
[5]You leave now.  Take ticket somewhere else. Next customer in line...! 
[6]Get out!
dialogues.MAN:
[1]Okay, Ill take them... 
[2]Can I help you? 
[3]Kate? No, theres no one here named Kate.  Is that good enough for you? 
[4]Hey, are you okay? 
[5]Is there anything I can do for you? 
[6]Hey, my wifes in the kitchen. You got a cigarette?
